name: House Blend (250g)
description:
Our House Blend is the one we send to cafes and is designed to be perect for a milk based espresso.

You'll find cocoa, caramel and subtle fruit flavours through the entire cup, with milk chocolate and toffee notes to finish it off.

name: The Dark Roast (250g)
description: For those who like it dark! Our dark blend, with a classic dark roasted flavour. Full bodied, rich, syrupy and candy like, with dark berry notes.

name: Rwanda 'Inzovu' (250G)
description:
Altitude 1200-1800 Metres / crop year 2013 / washed

What makes Rwanda Inzovu coffee so special is that itâ€™s produced by over 25,000 smallholder coffee farmers. Where the majority of the farmers only have around about 200 trees each to look after. The coffee production in Rwanda has seen exponential growth, benefiting the countries economic wellbeing. Due to the popularity and quality of this coffee, over the last several years the price paid directly to the farmers has significantly increased.

Caramel, lime and soft floral in aroma, black tea like, plum, lemon, thick body with tart green apple acidity, candied grape like sweetness, long finish.

name: PANAMA PASO ANCHO (250g)
description:
Origin Panama / Altitude 1650-2000mtrs / Crop Year 2013 / Varietal Caturra Typica

The Paso Ancho Valley is located in the Chiriqui province, close to the border with Costa Rica in western Panama. Paso Ancho Valley lies on the western slopes of the Baru Volcano. The Baru is an inactive volcano located between the Boquete and Volcan-Candela areas. At 3,500 meters above sea level, the Baru is the highest point in Panama. The Baru Volcano has provided very rich, deep and fertile soils to the Paso Ancho Valley micro region. This coupled with regular rainfall and appropriate altitude are a key factor in the outstanding quality portrayed by the coffee produced in this micro region.

The coffee from the Paso Ancho Valley is brought to Carmen Estate for processing. Fully ripe cherry is picked, immature green cherry is either hand sorted, over-ripe cherry is separated in floatation tanks & only prime red cherry is sent to pulpers. Pulped parchment is fermented for 24-72 hours in a wet fermentation process. The clean, washed parchment is sent for drying.

Floral, soft tropical note and apricot in aroma, dark fruit profile with plum and berries note,soft winey note, candied fruit- like sweetness, very balanced and rounded body, long toffee aftertaste

name: Sumatra Sipangan Bolon (250g)
description:
Altitude 900-1200mtrs / Crop Year 2013 / Varietal S795 & Typica

Our importers have been working directly with Dody & Fendi for the past 3 years, where they source these coffees directly and exclusively with a group of about 360 farmers, working about 400 hectares of land in the Sipangan Bolon region in North Sumatra.

This direct relationship helps us to understand their coffee production process, their quality issues and then implement often simple solutions to improve consistency and quality. 

This coffee has a clean and sweet chocolate aroma, soft herbal tones, dark chocolate, deep caramel sweetness with balanced apple-like acidity, fat body and long toffee finish. We're sure you'll enjoy it!

name: 1 Year Subscription
description:
A whole years worth of Brother In Law Coffee! 
For the serious coffee drinker, who doesn't want any hassle. There's no easier way to get great coffee delivered straight to your door. 

We'll send you two 250g bags of coffee every fortnight for a year. One of our house blend, and one roasters choice single origin.

Please note, the price includes postage (Australia only).

name: Aeropress
description:
The Aeropress is  a great single cup brewer, perfect for making your next cup of coffee! 

An innovative brewer, the Aeropress is fast becoming very popular, and we can see why. Easy to use, clean and store, it makes an amazing cup of coffee, with a variety of techniques to ensure you get the taste you're looking for. We ship with our personal aeropress brewing method.

name: Porlex Hand Grinder
description:
Made in Japan, these stainless steel hand grinders are great! With ceramic conical burs, they offer a consistent grind size and will last forever!

Perfect for travelling, taking to work, or anytime you want freshly ground coffee (which lets face it, is all the time).

name: Home brewing starter kit
description:
Includes an Aeropress, Porlex hand grinder and a bag of filter roasted single origin coffee (roasters choice). 

Perfect as a gift, or to get started brewing great coffee at home.

name: Able Metal Disc Filter
description: Metal replacement for the paper filters usually used in an Aeropress. Laser cut, made in the USA, the metal filter is simple, convenient and environmentally friendly. It also allows more of the coffee's natural oils to come through into the cup.

name: Aeropress Paper Filters
description: Replacement paper filters for when you run out.
